headline: Bill's Sausage Gravy
description: This is the best sausage gravy recipe. Pour over hot biscuits to make the best biscuits and gravy for a rich and hearty breakfast to enjoy at home.

video.description: See how to make a delicious sausage gravy.
video.name: Bill's Sausage Gravy

name: Bill's Sausage Gravy

recipeInstructions.text: Place sausage in a large, deep skillet. Cook and crumble over medium-high heat until evenly brown.

Remove sausage with a slotted spoon, leaving the drippings in the pan. Stir butter into the pan until melted. Add flour and stir until smooth. Reduce heat to medium and cook until light brown. Gradually whisk in milk and cook until thickened. Season with salt and pepper.
Add cooked sausage back to the skillet. Reduce heat and simmer for 12 to 15 minutes. If gravy becomes too thick, stir in a little more milk.

review.reviewBody: Better than anything you can get in a restaurant !!!
If it's bland add some sage.....goes great with the Maple flavor
Everyone loved it. I used country sausage because that's all I had. Added a splash of Maple syrup though. Very tasty.
My 1st try at making sausage gravy and biscuits ! Amazing flavor and I'm so easy
I make this all the time but I use hot sausage and add a swig of pure maple syrup. Perfect balance
Love this recipe, I substitute regular or spicy sausage instead of maple. I make it every time we do breakfast for dinner.
Followed recipe as a guide. Used 75% breakfast sausage & 25% sweet Italian sausage. Cut in some garlic powder , a light touch of smoky paprika & generous amounts of salt & pepper. Good stuff!

Found this recipe a few years ago, and it still is my go to. Making it now. Anyone who says it's bland, just add more salt. It literally says salt and pepper to taste. If that's not enough, then make it your own with whatever other herbs. I actually use exactly a half teaspoon of salt and the same amount of pepper. It adds just enough flavor to balance the saltiness of the biscuts. (I use store bought so they have their own flavor. Too much in the gravy will make the finished product far too salty). If you make your own biscuts, then maybe use a bit more. Just my 2 cents.
Definitely a keeper. Thank you!
My go-to sausage and gravy recipe every time! Perfect as written! With my homemade buttermilk biscuits, topped with 2-3 eggs and I'm a happy camper!

Super easy recipe and all the ratios were perfect. For those complaining about it being bland; You are not using enough salt and pepper. I used to work in the restaurant industry and the #1 mistake made by home cooks: not enough salt.
AMAZING! My family requests this all the time!
All I added was a shake of Garlic powder. Otherwise made it just like it is written. Wonderful... EasyPeasey and really Eatable.
Easy to follow recipe; especially for my novice self. Only change was to the sausage, hot instead of maple (none on hand), and a bit of paprika; but that gave it a little bit more kick and smokiness.
This recipe is easy and delicious. I made it as written with maple sausage. I also made some fresh biscuits. My wife loved it, as did I!
I used this recipe exactly as directed but went with regular sausage, delicious!!! Exactly as I remembered ... I will surely make this again and again. Thank you!
Made the recipe as instructed and it came out great!

Great recipe! I used spicy hot sausage in place of the maple flavor - we loved it!
My wife and I like it. Our daughter-in-law who is from SC, told me it was a proper white sauce. She liked it also. Just bought the fixings to make it again.

Made it today with regular sausage I had on hand and was great! At the end I decided to get a little creative and added just a dash of Everglades seasoning at the end and goodness it leveled the flavor a notch stronger! Now my go to recipe!

Great recipe added a teaspoon of fresh squeezed garlic juice 100plus rating!! Thank you Bill!!
This is even better than regular sausage gravy. I'll never serve it the old way again!

Some state it's blank, that's why you salt and pepper 'to taste'. You can add about 1/8-1/4 tsp of cayenne pepper for a kick. (Depends on your tolerance). Also I do like to make this more with Sage Sausage instead due to the Maple flavored one having limited availability. That gives it some good flavor!

So… I’ve have used this receipt for years and all my family raves about it. Even family that comes and visits us always say” only if your going to make us your sausage gravy biscuits “ Thank you for sharing this wonderful mouth watering receipt .
I will never buy sausage and gravy biscuits from a restaurant again! So long gravy packs! This recipe gets two thumbs up and I love how easy it was to make!

I am a biscuits and gravy aficionado and have compared 5 of the 5 star recepies to what my mother used to make and this is the only one that, I am sad to say, topped hers! Best gravy I have ever made!!
For those commenting it's bland. I love me some mustard on my biscuits and Gravy. It gives it a tang!

Love love love this recipe. Super easy and full of flavor. I’ve tried it with hot frozen Pattie’s from Walmart and when we didn’t have that even made it with Mexican Chorizo and my family still loved it! It deserves every 5 start it’s received!

Fantastic recipe! I prefer my sausage gravy a little spicy instead of sweet, so I use either hot sausage or regular with an added half teaspoon of red pepper flakes. It is easy and comes out perfect everytime! Thanks Bill!
How did this turn out

This was so good. The family loved it.
Absolutely the best!

I’m from the north and my southern boyfriend really wanted biscuits and gravy. I made this recipe and he LOVED it.**** we did make some changes. I used hot sausage and doubled the flour and he said it was the best gravy he’s ever had “just like grandma used to make”
Great recipe.
I made this with one adjustment, and it was a huge hit! I used 1 block Neese's Hot Sausage instead of the maple. Neese's is a must down here in the south!

This is definitely worthy of the 5-star review. We have made this several times and has become a staple. Anytime we make it for family, they love it as well. We add a bit of paprika for color & use any breakfast sausage, but other than that, we follow the recipe exactly as is. Makes great leftovers too!

I have used varied sausage. Add cumin besides. Sometime garlic powder. I use fat free milk and boil and stir til it thickens. 
Sticks with me all morning unlike cereal.

Excellent easy to make sausage gravy. I didn’t use the maple flavored sausage because I don’t care much for it. But using either Bob Evans Naturally or Jimmy Dean Original sausage, it has that tasty breakfast sausage spice that I love. When the sausage is about halfway fried, I get the oven preheated. Once preheated, I put the biscuits in and keep working on the gravy. Biscuits and gravy finish at the same time then it’s time to chow down! Just made it about a half hour ago for supper using sausage we had made by a local butcher from a hog we bought from a friend. Mmmm!!
Southern girl approved!!

I “accidentally” bought maple sausage and thought my h biscuits and gravy wouldn’t be any good. I found this recipe and I’m happy to say it was delicious! I did add some Cajun seasoning to spice it up but that was it. Hubby loved it!
This is perfect ratio of flour to milk. Very nice consistency.

This is delicious southern recipe was a big hit with my whole family. I bought the ingredients and made it while on vacation for a group of 12, and everyone loved it! I made mine with lactose-free whole milk because we have many in our group that are lactose intolerant.?

I have used and loved this recipe for several years now. It has completely spoiled me and I can rarely enjoy any other sausage gravy. We use cayenne pepper to taste, instead of black. Always double this recipe - it freezes well! Outstanding!
Combined with my husband's from scratch biscuits this is DELICIOUS!! For seasoning measures I use 1 tsp black pepper, 1/2 tsp salt, 1/4 tsp garlic powder
I think this is the best Sausage Gravy recipe on this site.
Phenomenal
I used venison sausage and it was a hit! Thank you!
Awesome!
My favorite homemade gravy— I use mild sausage instead of maple but delicious

Such a simple and straightforward recipe! I made it lighter by using 1% milk and light margarine and turkey sausage. Still thickened up nicely and you can season it as you like. I use a little cayenne to kick it up. Great recipe!
This is a delicious spin on plain old biscuits and gravy! Love!

Easy and delicious. I’m gonna be playing around with the flavors and substituting bacon grease next time, but this was the first recipe I’ve tried that I loved the first time around. Very popular in our house!
Followed the directions exactly and it was amazing! I used garlic salt for the salt and fresh ground pepper. Spooned
I use heavy whipping cream instead of milk because we like thicker gravy.
Excellent very tasty...used 2% milk and turned out fine with a little more flour
This is the easiest/best recipe I’ve ever made for gravy!! My family loved it
added extra cup of milk and additional flour to make more gravy.
I've made this a few times. its so good. it tastes great with the maple sausage.
I loved it! I used fat free/lactose free milk, otherwise I followed the recipe exactly and it was delicious.
I made this as is and my Husband loved it. The only thing I did different was add the whole pack of sausage instead of 12 oz. came out great.

Awesome and Good!

I made exactly as the recipe was written the family loved it and had seconds. I’ve never made sausage gravy and biscuits before as my mother never made it. I had never even had until I was a teenager. Next time I will leave out the maple syrup and use a spicier sausage.

really good recipe. I substituted turkey sausage and added about 2 Tbs of olive oil to get the amount of Greece you need.

Ok. It was a 5. Any mistakes are my own... no really. I can tell what not to do. So do NOT decide to use up your extra whipping cream in place of part of the milk. It really changes the flavor. Not in a bad way, just not a traditional biscuits and gravy flavor.

I made this for my husband on our 25th wedding anniversary. This turned out great!! I did use Italian sausage, but followed the directions. I don't make gravy, this was the first time! I don't even eat biscuits and gravy, but this was perfect!!! Will be making this many more times!! Thank you for posting this recipe!!

The only difference I made was I used a roll of Jimmy Dean reduced fat sausage as I’m not a huge fan of grease or maple flavor. Perfect! No more gravy packets for me!! Thanks so much for sharing this awesome recipe!!!
So good! I'm gonna try adding some onion powder next time though!
Yum , Yum and Yummers!! no extra words necessary
Very good! Family loved it! Will make again.

Turned out great! I used Owens breakfast sausage because my husband doesn’t like maple. I also used 1 can of evaporated milk (about 2 cups ) for more creaminess and the rest was whole milk. Also added a dash of cayenne along with salt and lots of black pepper.

I’ve made this several times but NOT with maple sausage. I’ve used regular Jimmy Dean sausage but because of the rave reviews on using maple sausage I will definitely give it a try. I follow recipe with rest of ingredients except I use 2% milk which is what I always have on hand, I did use fat free milk once and it worked good too. I also added some ground coriander and enough S&P to taste. I did have to add little more milk as it was a little too thick. Next time will def try the maple and even sage sausage.

This is easy and fantastic.... I use spicy breakfast sausage instead.... huge hit in our home.... it’s becoming a weekend favorite

good Lord!!!! This was absolutely delicious!! I used hot sausage because that's all I had. My husband loved it and I will make it again next time with the maple sausage.
